description: Airbnb is an online community marketplace for people to list, discover, and book accommodations through mobile phones or the Internet.
company_overview: Rebecca Van Dyck, a veteran of Meta, Apple, and Wieden + Kennedy, joins Airbnb as Chief Marketing Officer, bringing extensive marketing experience to lead the company's marketing, research, and creative teams.
news: Ald. Anthony Napolitano, 41st, is pushing forward legislation that would give aldermen the ability to unilaterally ban new rentals on a precinct-by-precinct level. The City Council’s License and Consumer Protection Committee is set to consider the legislation Wednesday. Airbnb says the ban is an "unnecessary violation of Chicagoans' constitutional property rights" The company says it has seen a 78% drop in the number of party reports since the ban was proposed. The city says it will use the money from the ban to fight homelessness and domestic violence. Ald. Napolitano said his measure “flips the script” to place the onus on companies instead of residents. Some aldermen, like Southwest Side Ald. Marty Quinn, have pushed forward with signature-collection efforts that have blocked Airbnb in large swaths of wards. Alderman: Pre-existing short-term rental units would be allowed to continue operating if rentals were banned in a precinct. He shared concerns that the rentals drive up housing costs or harm tax revenue brought in by hotels, but added that his goal is “not to hurt Airbnb.” Ald. Jessie Fuentes worries rentals might push her residents out of theirs. Most of the guests she welcomes are traveling professionals or tourists visiting nearby family. “I allow into my home and my freedom of allowing people to stay in my home,” Torres said. “When you begin to short up the amount of units in our city, it begins to also inflate those prices,” she says. “I just think there needs to be some form of regulation,’ she adds. ‘I am not anti-Airbnb. I’m just against short-term rentals.’ Billionaire Joe Gebbia had been under consideration to take over DOGE, people say. But he told others he was not interested in a role in which he alone would lead, they say. That is in part because of the intense scrutiny that would come with a formal role in charge.

Joe Gebbia.wikipedia_summary: Joseph Gebbia Jr. (/'gebia/; born August 21, 1981) is an American designer and entrepreneur, and a co-founder of  Airbnb. Gebbia is on the board of directors of Airbnb, but has not been involved in the operations of the company since 2022.

Nathan Blecharczyk.wikipedia_summary: Nathan Blecharczyk /blə'ʃɑrzɪk/ (born 1983) is the co-founder and chief strategy officer of Airbnb, and chairman of Airbnb China. Blecharczyk was also the company's first chief technology officer. Blecharczyk is the 203rd richest person in the world according to Forbes, with a net worth of $9.4 billion, mostly due to his ownership of 62 million shares of Airbnb.
